comment: I took 7765 and was easily the hardest and most frustrating class I've ever taken. There were SO many assignments. No instructions were ever clear or made complete sense. Dr. Cobb will not answer an email if you ever need help. She does not put in grades until it is too late to fix things. I would not take her again if I had to retake this course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She is very sweet but I did not like this class. Only graded assignments at the middle/end of the semester, never responded to emails, often posted homework late, and overall just seemed all over the place sometimes. Homework was pretty tedious but some of it was good. She is a nice person but everything felt a bit unorganized, causing frustration.

If you like not to have anything graded until 30 minutes before grades are due then pick her. Dr.Cobb showed up to class late every day. we had weekly assignments and then in class lectures did not really correspond to the homework. We did all that work to not even know any of our grades until after emailing her and final grades in.

Dr. Cobb was a great lecturer and was very nice! All of her assignments are open from day 1 and you could complete them very fast if you choose to. There are about two simple assignments a week and 4 essays total. She does not grade until the end of the semester so you will not know your grade until then. Complete work on time and you'll do well!!

Dr. Cobb was a really good professor. Her lectures were very detailed, and I believe that I learned a lot from this course to help prepare me for my future. She takes a long time to grade, but if you do the work and put in effort, you will be fine in the class. Dr. Cobb is also very unbiased and she wants to hear from all of her students!

Dr. Cobb is a great professor. She gives great lectures, and there are only a couple of pretty simple assignments a week. However, she takes a while to release grades, and you will not know your grade in the class until late into the semester.
Dr.Cobb was really cool and chill, yes it was a lot of work but if you go to class and pay attain its all ver easy. A lot of videos in her class to go with the work we did. Easy grader overall.
Do not expect an email back... the class is not super hard but she will not take late work and lectures pretty heavy. Overall easy class just not the best set up for content
Dr. Cobb is very sweet, and I enjoyed her lectures a lot, however she took really long to grade some things, and isn't very accessible outside of class. Definitely take her if you can, just be ready.

4 papers,15hr field experience, a few discussions, and readings assignments. She takes forever to grade and respond to emails. She is very understanding and willing to accept late work if you talk to her. Attendance is taken for a grade. You will learn from her assignments and the real-life situations she gives.

This class was very enjoyable and I looked forward to this class every week. The teacher instructs this class very well without any bias and does an incredible job at making sure everyone is heard. The only thing that I did not like about this class was how long it took for my assignments to be graded.

Dr. Cobb is pretty good. Her grading takes FOREVER, so be prepared. The class itself was fine; textbook was not mandatory due to a shortage this semester. She's super nice, but I felt as if she was not very good at giving me actual things that I would take into the classroom. Learned a whole lot more from my field experience than from the class.

Dr. Cobb makes her class entertaining by having interesting discussions,sharing real life scenarios she's had in the classroom as a teacher.Her classwork load is kind of a lot with 3 papers, one 15hr field experience which many of us enjoyed and mini discussions and readings due each week. Overall,she's an easy grader though. Attendance is a grade.

Professor Cobb is a professor that you will miss when you leave her class. She was very engaged with all of her students throughout class and always asked our opinions and listened to our sides on everything. There are no tests, only a few papers throughout the semester, 3-4 assignments to complete each week, and an in person field experience.

Dr,Cobb is the type of professor you wish all your professors were like. I absolutely enjoyed this class with her and she is so helpful. She allowed me to make up assignments I missed and she is very caring and understanding. Don't take it for granted, but I wish she taught all my classes. Here course material is super simple.

Mixed feelings about this class. Professor Cobb did a variety of activities besides just lecture & our class had lively discussions as well. However, her class was very disorganized. She changed things from the syllabus and didn't put in grades until the end of the semester. I think this is because she's new, but it was still frustrating for me.

Waits to grade everything until the very end of the semester. Attendance isn't mandatory but does count for a grade in the end. A TON of busy work, every week. The papers you write will be graded harshly and will be about subject matter that doesn't make sense. Nothing is explained. Save yourself a semester of confusion and meaningless work.
